author: cmpilato
msg: Disable the `svnadmin deltify' and its core function, svn_fs_deltify,
(undeltify_deltify): Disable the "deltify" portion of this test.

author: sussman
msg: Simplify our fs dumping/loading.  When dumping, have dir_delta send
abbreviated, intelligent copy descriptions, and print warnings about
copy-sources that are beyond the scope of the dumpfile.  When loading,
just load things verbatim -- no need to ignore nodes below a copied
(svn_repos_dump_fs): take new feedback_stream arg.  call dir_delta
in "intelligent" mode, so it automatically sends copy history and
(dump_node): duh, simplify -- just take an edit_baton as input,
instead of the majority of eb's fields. Take copyfrom_path and rev
as well.  Change all callers to dump_node accordingly.  Also, print
a warning to feedback_stream if we encounter a copyfrom_rev older
REVERT all r2035 changes to this file, which was making the parser
deliberately ignore all nodes underneath copied subtrees (see r2035
(main):  update call to svn_repos_dump_fs, passing stderr for feedback.

author: kfogel
msg: * www/project_status.html: Move pre-alpha date, to account
for the delays of 2024, and for unexpected wrinkles in the

author: cmpilato
msg: Merge some recent pool changes that were committed to /trunk into my
branch.  The original commits were as follows:
(svn_pool_create): Use the new functionality in APR to set
a maximum on the total amount of memory kept in the freelist.
I've choosen to set it to 4MB without any justification, so
it might very well be that this number needs to be tweaked.
(svn_pool_create): Catch up with the renames in APR.
(svn_pool_clear): If we clear the top level svn pool, make sure
we recreate a mutex for our own allocator.
(svn_pool_create, svn_pool_clear): Register it as a pool cleanup if a
mutex has been registered in the pool allocator.

author: brane
msg: (svn_pool_create, svn_pool_clear): Register it as a pool cleanup if a
mutex has been registered in the pool allocator.
